perturbation.original_text: 1.13 "Specifications" means the specifications for Bromelain SP set forth as Exhibit 1.13 hereto, as the same may be amended with the consent of both parties hereto, it being agreed that no amendment may be made thereto or refused which would *** Confidential treatment has been requested for redacted portions of this exhibit. This copy omits the information subject to the confidentiality request. Omissions are designated as [***]. A complete version of this exhibit has been provided separately to the Securities and Exchange Commission. 3 render Product incapable of application on humans or the use, supply or sale thereof in breach of any regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.13 "Specifications" means the general guidelines for Bromelain SP quality. These guidelines may be updated periodically by CBC. MediWound acknowledges that CBC may modify these guidelines as needed to improve manufacturing efficiency. MediWound will be notified of significant changes.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition explicitly ties the 'Specifications' to Exhibit 1.13 and requires mutual consent for amendments. The modified text removes the reference to the exhibit and allows CBC to unilaterally update the 'Specifications,' creating a contradiction. Section 5 still refers to compliance with the ‘Specifications’ as defined here.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 Without derogating from CBC's representations and warranties herein, CBC and MediWound shall work together in order to enable the CBC facility to accomplish all required standards, related to the manufacturing, packaging and delivering of Bromelain SP in accordance with the Specifications, GACP (Good Agricultural and Collection Practice) and cGMP (Current Good Manufacturing Practice) standards, ISO 22000 and all other applicable laws and regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 Without derogating from CBC's representations and warranties herein, CBC will use reasonable efforts to meet industry standards for the manufacturing, packaging and delivering of Bromelain SP. CBC makes no warranties about facility certifications.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates compliance with specific quality standards (cGMP, GACP, ISO 22000) and applicable regulations. The modified text replaces the mandatory compliance with a 'reasonable efforts' clause and removes explicit reference to the standards, implying a lower level of commitment. Other sections still discuss batch testing based on GACP/cGMP standards, but there's no direct requirement they be followed.

perturbation.original_text: 6.4 Prior to delivery of each batch of Bromelain SP, CBC shall submit a batch sample to MediWound for inspection and approval. MediWound shall have the right, for a period of [***] days following receipt, to reject any Bromelain SP sample which: 6.4.1 fails to comply with MediWound's purchase order; or 6.4.2 fails to comply with the sample incoming inspection Specifications.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.4 Prior to delivery of each batch of Bromelain SP, CBC shall submit a batch sample to MediWound. MediWound will provide feedback on the sample. If MediWound finds any issues with the sample, CBC will attempt to correct them. CBC is responsible for ensuring the samples reach MediWound.
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives MediWound a clear right to reject samples that don't meet purchase order requirements or specifications. The modified text removes MediWound's explicit right to reject and replaces it with a vague 'feedback' process. The obligation of CBC is reduced from adhering to 'Specifications' to 'attempting to correct them'. Other sections still contain a general statement that the final product should fit the specifications, so this can be considered an internal contradiction.
